name: Olorotitan
overview: Olorotitan is a monotypic genus of lambeosaurine duck-billed dinosaur, containing a single species, O. arharensis. It was among the last non-avian dinosaurs to go extinct during the Cretaceousâ€“Paleogene extinction event, having lived from the middle to late Maastrichtian age of the Late Cretaceous period. The remains were found in the Udurchukan Formation beds of Kundur, Arkharinsky District, Amur Oblast, Eastern Russia, in the vicinity of the Amur River.

researchContext.evidenceBase: Olorotitan is represented by published fossil material, but completeness and diagnostic overlap can limit high-confidence biological reconstruction.
researchContext.currentLimits: Several ecological and life-history traits remain inferential rather than directly measured for this taxon.
researchContext.nextDataNeeded: Priority evidence includes better-preserved cranial/postcranial overlap, robust stratigraphic control, and specimen-linked morphometrics.
researchContext.revisionOutlook: Interpretation is expected to improve as new finds and reanalyses clarify taxonomy and anatomy.

funFacts: Olorotitan remains an active target for revision as new material is compared across related taxa.
Dino-pedia marks uncertain claims explicitly so this article can be upgraded with specimen-level evidence.
